title: Total amount of water pumped from a lake

content.question: Water is pumped out of a lake at the rate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><msqrt> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>t</mi> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4020@</annotation> </semantics> </math> cubic meters per minute, where t is measured in minutes. How much water is pumped from time t = 0 to t = 5?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
